title: Awesome List Updates on Oct 07, 2020
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Oct 07, 2020 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Mac
items.content_text:
### Audio and Video Tools / File Sharing

*   [Recordia](https://sindresorhus.com/recordia) - Record audio directly from the menu bar or with a global keyboard shortcut. [![App Store](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-app-store.svg "App Store Software")](https://apps.apple.com/app/id1529006487)
items.content_html:
Audio and Video Tools / File Sharing

  • Recordia - Record audio directly from the menu bar or with a global keyboard shortcut.

items.title: Awesome Algorithms Education
items.content_text:
### Competitions / Advanced

*   [Google Code Jam](https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/codejam) - Google‚Äôs largest coding competition, calls on programmers around the world to put their skills to the test by solving multiple rounds of algorithmic puzzles.
items.content_html:
Competitions / Advanced

  • Google Code Jam - Google‚Äôs largest coding competition, calls on programmers around the world to put their skills to the test by solving multiple rounds of algorithmic puzzles.

items.title: Awesome Earth
items.content_text:
### Volunteering

*   [World Cleanup Day](https://www.worldcleanupday.org/) - World Cleanup Day is a civic movement, uniting 180 countries and millions of people across the world to clean up the planet. In one day. Volunteers and partners worldwide come together to rid our planet of trash ‚Äì cleaning up litter and mismanaged waste from our beaches, rivers, forests, and streets.
items.content_html:
Volunteering

  • World Cleanup Day - World Cleanup Day is a civic movement, uniting 180 countries and millions of people across the world to clean up the planet. In one day. Volunteers and partners worldwide come together to rid our planet of trash ‚Äì cleaning up litter and mismanaged waste from our beaches, rivers, forests, and streets.

items.title: Awesome Django
items.content_text:
### Third-Party Packages / Caching

*   [django-cachalot (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/noripyt/django-cachalot) - Caches your Django ORM queries and automatically invalidates them.
*   [django-cacheops (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/Suor/django-cacheops) - A slick ORM cache with automatic granular event-driven invalidation.
items.content_html:
Third-Party Packages / Caching

  • django-cachalot (‚≠ê1.4k) - Caches your Django ORM queries and automatically invalidates them.
  • django-cacheops (‚≠ê2.2k) - A slick ORM cache with automatic granular event-driven invalidation.

### UI

UI

items.title: Awesome Postgres
items.content_text:
### Contents / PaaS *(PostgreSQL as a Service)*

*   [Google Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL](https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/postgres/) - Fully-managed database service that makes it easy to set up, maintain, manage, and administer your PostgreSQL relational databases on Google Cloud Platform.
items.content_html:
Contents / PaaS (PostgreSQL as a Service)

  • Google Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL - Fully-managed database service that makes it easy to set up, maintain, manage, and administer your PostgreSQL relational databases on Google Cloud Platform.

items.content_html:
High-Level Frameworks / Multi-accounts setup

  • cdk-stepfunctions-patterns (‚≠ê67) - A set of Step Functions high-level resiliency patterns.

items.title: Awesome Actions
items.content_text:
### GitHub Tools and Management / Docker Container Actions

*   [Copybara Action (‚≠ê110)](https://github.com/olivr/copybara-action) - Move and transform code between repositories (ideal to maintain several repos from one monorepo).
items.content_html:
GitHub Tools and Management / Docker Container Actions

  • Copybara Action (‚≠ê110) - Move and transform code between repositories (ideal to maintain several repos from one monorepo).

items.title: Awesome Fuzzing
items.content_text:
### Papers / USENIX Security

*   [FANS: Fuzzing Android Native System Services via Automated Interface Analysis, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/liu)
*   [Analysis of DTLS Implementations Using Protocol State Fuzzing, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/fiterau-brostean)
*   [EcoFuzz: Adaptive Energy-Saving Greybox Fuzzing as a Variant of the Adversarial Multi-Armed Bandit, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/yue)
*   [Fuzzing Error Handling Code using Context-Sensitive Software Fault Injection, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/jiang)
*   [FuzzGen: Automatic Fuzzer Generation, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/ispoglou)
*   [ParmeSan: Sanitizer-guided Greybox Fuzzing, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/osterlund)
*   [SpecFuzz: Bringing Spectre-type vulnerabilities to the surface, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/oleksenko)
*   [FuzzGuard: Filtering out Unreachable Inputs in Directed Grey-box Fuzzing through Deep Learning, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/zong)
*   [Montage: A Neural Network Language Model-Guided JavaScript Engine Fuzzer, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/lee-suyoung)
*   [GREYONE: Data Flow Sensitive Fuzzing, 2020](https://www.usenix.org/conference/usenixsecurity20/presentation/gan)
items.content_html:
Papers / USENIX Security

  • FANS: Fuzzing Android Native System Services via Automated Interface Analysis, 2020
  • Analysis of DTLS Implementations Using Protocol State Fuzzing, 2020
  • EcoFuzz: Adaptive Energy-Saving Greybox Fuzzing as a Variant of the Adversarial Multi-Armed Bandit, 2020
  • Fuzzing Error Handling Code using Context-Sensitive Software Fault Injection, 2020
  • FuzzGen: Automatic Fuzzer Generation, 2020
  • ParmeSan: Sanitizer-guided Greybox Fuzzing, 2020
  • SpecFuzz: Bringing Spectre-type vulnerabilities to the surface, 2020
  • FuzzGuard: Filtering out Unreachable Inputs in Directed Grey-box Fuzzing through Deep Learning, 2020
  • Montage: A Neural Network Language Model-Guided JavaScript Engine Fuzzer, 2020
  • GREYONE: Data Flow Sensitive Fuzzing, 2020

items.title: Awesome Ada
items.content_text:
### Online Books

*   [ada-95-tutorial](https://perso.telecom-paristech.fr/pautet/Ada95/a95list.htm) - A book going from beginner to advanced concepts in Ada 95, complete with source files.

### Specialties

*   [ada-at-rosetta-code](https://rosettacode.org/wiki/Category:Ada) - A collection of programming tasks and their sample solutions in Ada.

### Text Modes / Apache License

*   [vim-ada-bundle (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/thindil/Ada-Bundle) - Maintained Ada Bundle : Complete Ada-Mode for Vim/NeoVim.

### VSCode Extensions / Apache License

*   [ada-vscode (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/Lucretia/ada-vscode) - Basic syntax highlighting for Ada and GPR.

### Runtimes / Apache License

*   [adawebpack (‚≠ê67)](https://github.com/godunko/adawebpack) - GNAT RTL for WASM and bindings for Web API.

### Terminal User Interface / Apache License

*   [curses (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/annexi-strayline/Curses) - Advanced UNIX Terminal UI Ada Binding Package.

### 3D / Apache License

*   [engine-3d (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/zertovitch/engine-3d) - A 3D engine for DOS-talgics.

### Generation / Apache License

*   [record-flux (‚≠ê116)](https://github.com/Componolit/RecordFlux) - RecordFlux: Toolset for the formal specification of messages and the generation of verifiable binary parsers and message generators in SPARK.

### Math / Apache License

*   [lalg (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/jhumphry/LALG) - Interface to dense linear algebra packages.

### Cryptography / Apache License

*   [threefish (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/jrcarter/Threefish) - Ada Implementation of the Threefish-256 Encryption Algorithm.
*   [ada-crypto-library (‚≠ê85)](https://github.com/cforler/Ada-Crypto-Library) - This is a crypto library for Ada with a nice API and is written for the i386 and x86\_64 hardware architecture.
*   [spark-nacl (‚≠ê122)](https://github.com/rod-chapman/SPARKNaCl) - SPARK 2014 re-implementation of the TweetNaCl crypto library.
*   [libsodium-ada (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/jrmarino/libsodium-ada) - A secure cryptographic library (libsodium for Ada).
*   [ada-libsecret (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/stcarrez/ada-libsecret) - Ada Binding for the libsecret library.

### Compression / Apache License

*   [ada-lzma (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/stcarrez/ada-lzma) - Ada binding for liblzma compression library.

### Parsers, Scanners, Linters, Analysers, Interpreters and Prettyprinters / Apache License

*   [libadalang (‚≠ê155)](https://github.com/AdaCore/libadalang/) - Libadalang is a library for parsing and semantic analysis of Ada code. It is meant as a building block for integration into other tools (IDE, static analyzers, etc).

### Networking and Communication Middleware / Apache License

*   [adasockets (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/samueltardieu/adasockets) - IPv4 socket library (TCP, UDP, and multicast).
*   [dbus-ada](https://codelabs.ch/dbus-ada/index.html) - The D\_Bus/Ada library provides an Ada binding to the D-Bus message bus system.
*   [zeromq-ada](https://github.com/persan/zeromq-Ada.git) - Binding to the ZeroMQ comunications-library.

### Chatting and Communication / Apache License

*   [axmpp (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/coopht/axmpp) - With the AXMPP library you can connect to a Jabber server to send and receive messages.
*   [weechat-ada (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/onox/weechat-ada) - Ada 2012 library for WeeChat plug-ins.
*   [weechat-canberra (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/onox/weechat-canberra) - A WeeChat plug-in written in Ada 2012 that plays sounds using Canberra.
*   [weechat-emoji (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/onox/weechat-emoji) - A WeeChat plug-in written in Ada 2012 that displays emoji.

### Graphics and Multimedia / Apache License

*   [adagl (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/godunko/adagl) - Multiplatform Ada/OpenGL bindings (ported to native/OpenGL, A2JS/WebGL and WASM/WebGL).
*   [sdlada (‚≠ê123)](https://github.com/Lucretia/sdlada) - Ada 2012 bindings to SDL 2.
*   [ada-nanovg (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/raph-amiard/ada-nanovg) - Ada bindings to NanoVG.
*   [free-type-ada (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/flyx/FreeTypeAda) - FreeType binding for Ada 2005.

### General Purpose Computing / Apache License

*   [opencl-ada (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/flyx/OpenCLAda) - An Ada binding for the OpenCL host API.

### Sound / Apache License

*   [opus-ada (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/onox/opus-ada) - Ada 2012 bindings for the Opus audio codec.
*   [canberra-ada (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/onox/canberra-ada) - Ada 2012 bindings for libcanberra, an implementation of the XDG Sound Theme and Name Specifications.
*   [ada-soundio (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/raph-amiard/ada-soundio) - Ada bindings for libsoundio.
*   [oto (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/darkestkhan/oto) - Ada binding to OpenAL which tries to mimic original API while using Ada types.

### Localization / Apache License

*   [zanyblue](https://sourceforge.net/projects/zanyblue/) - An Ada package allowing the externalization of application messages into a properties file.

### Utilities / Apache License

*   [a-stream-tools](https://github.com/persan/a-stream-tools.git) - Stream utilities for Ada2005 and 2012.

### Robotics / Apache License

*   [rclada (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/ada-ros/rclada) - Ada client library for ROS2/RCL.
*   [player-ada (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/mosteo/player-ada) - Ada bindings for the player robotic platform.

### Linux and POSIX / Apache License

*   [florist](https://www.cs.fsu.edu/~baker/florist.html) - POSIX Ada binding, IEEE Standards 1003.5(b,c).
*   [wposix (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/AdaCore/wposix) - Ada Windows POSIX binding.
*   [ada-v4l2 (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/frett27/AdaV4L2) - Ada Posix Binding to Video 4 Linux, used for RPI.
*   [inotify-ada (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/onox/inotify-ada) - An Ada 2012 library for monitoring filesystem events using Linux' inotify API.
*   [dl-ada (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/mosteo/dl-ada) - Minimal binding to libdl.

### Windows and .NET / Apache License

*   [win32ada (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/AdaCore/win32ada) - Ada API to the Windows library.
*   [ada-net-framework (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/Alex-Gamper/Ada-NetFramework) - Ada bindings to the Microsoft NetFramework Api.
*   [ada-winrt (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/Alex-Gamper/Ada-WinRT) - Ada bindings for the Microsft WinRT Api.
*   [ada-win32 (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/Alex-Gamper/Ada-Win32) - Ada bindings for the Microsoft Win32 Api.

### Drivers / Apache License

*   [em-brick (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/it-cosmos/emBRICK) - emBRICK driver and support for emBRICK in Ada.

### Applications / Apache License

*   [micro-tem-pi (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/jklmnn/MicroTemPi) - Raspberry Pi using a BBC Micro:Bit as temperature sensor.

### Simulation / Apache License

*   [covid-19-simulator (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/ohenley/COVID-19_Simulator) - Multi engine/algorithms COVID-19 simulator. Ada, Qt code under the hood.

### Generators and Translators / Apache License

*   [ada-magic](https://www.mapusoft.com/ada-to-c-changer/) - SofCheck AdaMagic is ACATS validated and certified Ada compiler targeting C and/or C++ (4 command line switches for fine tuning). ObjectAda and several other commercial compilers share engine with AdaMagic. MapuSoft distributes AdaMagic as integral component of AppCOE.

  • ada-95-tutorial - A book going from beginner to advanced concepts in Ada 95, complete with source files.

Specialties

  • ada-at-rosetta-code - A collection of programming tasks and their sample solutions in Ada.

  • record-flux (‚≠ê116) - RecordFlux: Toolset for the formal specification of messages and the generation of verifiable binary parsers and message generators in SPARK.

Cryptography / Apache License

  • spark-nacl (‚≠ê122) - SPARK 2014 re-implementation of the TweetNaCl crypto library.
  • libsodium-ada (‚≠ê8) - A secure cryptographic library (libsodium for Ada).

  • ada-lzma (‚≠ê6) - Ada binding for liblzma compression library.

Parsers, Scanners, Linters, Analysers, Interpreters and Prettyprinters / Apache License

  • libadalang (‚≠ê155) - Libadalang is a library for parsing and semantic analysis of Ada code. It is meant as a building block for integration into other tools (IDE, static analyzers, etc).

Chatting and Communication / Apache License

  • weechat-emoji (‚≠ê2) - A WeeChat plug-in written in Ada 2012 that displays emoji.

Graphics and Multimedia / Apache License

  • adagl (‚≠ê11) - Multiplatform Ada/OpenGL bindings (ported to native/OpenGL, A2JS/WebGL and WASM/WebGL).
  • sdlada (‚≠ê123) - Ada 2012 bindings to SDL 2.
  • ada-nanovg (‚≠ê1) - Ada bindings to NanoVG.
  • free-type-ada (‚≠ê1) - FreeType binding for Ada 2005.

General Purpose Computing / Apache License

  • opencl-ada (‚≠ê15) - An Ada binding for the OpenCL host API.

Sound / Apache License

  • opus-ada (‚≠ê2) - Ada 2012 bindings for the Opus audio codec.
  • canberra-ada (‚≠ê4) - Ada 2012 bindings for libcanberra, an implementation of the XDG Sound Theme and Name Specifications.
  • ada-soundio (‚≠ê5) - Ada bindings for libsoundio.
  • oto (‚≠ê3) - Ada binding to OpenAL which tries to mimic original API while using Ada types.

Localization / Apache License

  • zanyblue - An Ada package allowing the externalization of application messages into a properties file.

Utilities / Apache License

  • a-stream-tools - Stream utilities for Ada2005 and 2012.

Robotics / Apache License

  • rclada (‚≠ê11) - Ada client library for ROS2/RCL.
  • player-ada (‚≠ê4) - Ada bindings for the player robotic platform.

Linux and POSIX / Apache License

  • florist - POSIX Ada binding, IEEE Standards 1003.5(b,c).
  • wposix (‚≠ê4) - Ada Windows POSIX binding.
  • ada-v4l2 (‚≠ê0) - Ada Posix Binding to Video 4 Linux, used for RPI.
  • inotify-ada (‚≠ê9) - An Ada 2012 library for monitoring filesystem events using Linux' inotify API.
  • dl-ada (‚≠ê1) - Minimal binding to libdl.

Windows and .NET / Apache License

  • win32ada (‚≠ê19) - Ada API to the Windows library.
  • ada-net-framework (‚≠ê5) - Ada bindings to the Microsoft NetFramework Api.
  • ada-winrt (‚≠ê11) - Ada bindings for the Microsft WinRT Api.
  • ada-win32 (‚≠ê3) - Ada bindings for the Microsoft Win32 Api.

Drivers / Apache License

  • em-brick (‚≠ê0) - emBRICK driver and support for emBRICK in Ada.

Applications / Apache License

  • micro-tem-pi (‚≠ê2) - Raspberry Pi using a BBC Micro:Bit as temperature sensor.

Simulation / Apache License

Generators and Translators / Apache License

  • ada-magic - SofCheck AdaMagic is ACATS validated and certified Ada compiler targeting C and/or C++ (4 command line switches for fine tuning). ObjectAda and several other commercial compilers share engine with AdaMagic. MapuSoft distributes AdaMagic as integral component of AppCOE.
